716926f-a.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - South Street
716926f-a.text:
140-124 Broad Street, west side, from South to Front Streets,
inclusive, also showing 13-11 South Street, at, adjoining, and west
of the N.W. corner of Broad Street.
February 23, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
716926f-a.folder: Broad Street & South Street, Manhattan, NY

723233f-a.title: Manhattan: South Street - Broad Street
723233f-a.text:
South Street, north side, east fro Bread Street, to Coenties Slip.
A general view, is shown of lower Manhattan, as viewed northward from
Pier 5, at the foot of Coenties Slip.
1924.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
A portion of view 1, showing Nos. 15-17, 18, 19, 20 and 21. No. 15-17
is the 7-story Broad Street Hospital, shown on the left.
April 17, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
723233f-a.folder: South Street & Broad Street, Manhattan, NY

723234f-b.title: Manhattan: South Street - Broad Street
723234f-b.text:
South Street, north side, east from Broad Street to Coenties
Siip, showing buildings that face the East River. The Broad
Street Hospital is at the left at Broad Street and the Seaman's
Church Institute at Coenties Slip. The triangular park at the
latter point is Jeanette Park. This was named after Jeannette
Bennett, sister of James Gordon Bennett Sr., editor of the New
York Herald, who financed an expedition to the Artic in 1879
with Lieutenant Commander George W. DeLong in command of the
425 ton vessel ''Jeannette.''
Beyond is the Brooklyn Bridge.
View 1: November 1927
George H. Balgue
MAY BE REPRODUCED
View 2: August 18, 1935
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
723234f-b.folder: South Street & Broad Street, Manhattan, NY

716866f-b.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - South Street
716866f-b.text:
(1)
Broad Street, north from South Street. The first large building
seen is the New York Telephone Company. Beyond it is the skeleton
of the Stone \& Webster Building.
October 2, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, showing also in the distance the 36-story Maritime
Exchange Building nearing completion.
December 20, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
716866f-b.folder: Broad Street & South Street, Manhattan, NY
